Comments: No disclosure found. Etisalat states in its Annual Report 2017 (Source 13) that "the company works continuously to respect and protect human rights – its most important obligation as a member of a global society" but this policy does not make any explicit commitment to respect users' freedom of expression. Etisalat further discloses in the Statement of continued support by the Chief Executive Officer that “Etisalat reaffirms its support of the Ten Principles of the United Nations Global Compact in its effort to fight for human rights, its defense of labour and the environment, and its efforts to combat corruption" (Source 15). However, the Ten Principles of the United Nations Global Compact make no explicit reference to freedom of expression.

Comments: No disclosure found. On its Customer Care channel (Source 17), the company commits to handling customer complaints "with the highest quality of Etisalat Services and Products and our goal is to always meet or exceed our customer expectations and needs. If for any reason you are dissatisfied with Etisalat’s service, it is important that you inform us. Contacting us gives us the opportunity to continually improve our services and will enable us to quickly address any problems you are experiencing." However, the company provides no information at all about its procedures for providing remedy to complaints.

Comments:
Etisalat's fixed line broadband service is covered by two separate policy documents The company's "General Terms and Conditions-Consumer Products" (Source 6), as well as a separate terms and conditions document for the broadband service (Source 9,10).

Partial. Etisalat's general terms of service (Source 6) are not easy to find. A user has to scroll down to the bottom of the homepage and click "Terms & Conditions". Once a user clicks this tab, the terms and conditions for the website and online services appear. General terms and conditions for consumer products can then be accessed by clicking the first PDF link "General Terms and Conditions-Consumer Products" under "Other Terms & Conditions" at the bottom of the page.  Etisalat's terms of service for fixed line broadband (Source 9,10) could not be located on the Etisalat website and could only be found using a search engine.

Etisalat's postpaid service is covered by two separate policy documents: The company's "General Terms and Conditions-Consumer Products" (Source 6), as well as a separate terms and conditions document for postpaid mobile service (Source 8).

Partial. Etisalat's general terms of service (Source 6) are not easy to find. A user has to scroll down to the bottom of the homepage and click "Terms & Conditions". Once a user clicks this tab, the terms and conditions for the website and online services appear. The terms and conditions document for postpaid mobile service (Source 8) are not located in the most intuitive place either. They can be accessed by clicking the "Mobile" tab. The user then has to select "Postpaid Plan" from the "Mobile Plans" tab. Next, the "new postpaid" option has to be selected from the menu, and the user has to scroll down to the bottom of the page to click the "Term and conditions".

Etisalat's prepaid service is covered by two separate policy documents: The company's "General Terms and Conditions-Consumer Products" (Source 6), as well as a separate terms and conditions document for prepaid mobile service (Source 7).

However, in paragraph (d) the company commits to "give the Customer reasonable notice prior to such termination..."Because it is not clear if and when the company notifies users when it restricts accounts, partial credit is awarded.

Partial. Etisalat  does not clearly explain why it may shut down service to a particular area or group of users. In the general terms of service (Source 6, section 14a) the company discloses that it "does not guarantee that the Service will be available in all areas of the UAE at all times or that there will be no interruptions or interference to the Service." It further notes that, "The Customer acknowledges that there may be unplanned outages which may cause disruption to the Service" (14c). Section 19(a) further provides that "Subject to applicable laws and regulations Etisalat may suspend / disconnect or terminate immediately the use of part or all of the Service and/or the Agreement...in the event that,...(iii) Etisalat is required to do so under any applicable laws or regulations, or under any other regulatory requirements, or upon request by Government or regulatory or security or other competent authorities, or is required by necessity of an emergency situation..." However, it is not clear whether this could include network shutdowns.

No disclosure found. In its privacy policy, Etisalat (Source 1) states that "We may be required to disclose your personal information or legally intercept the services to comply with the laws of the UAE or the express instructions of a competent authority." No information found regarding the company's process for responding to these requests.

Partial. Etisalat's Code of Practices (Source 4, section 9) has the following broad disclosure: "Etisalat has strict policies governing employee access to customer records. Partial. Etisalat discloses the following in its 2017 Annual Report: "The threat of external cyber attacks across the Etisalat network and IT infrastructure is ever-present, particularly across the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region. Network and IT security teams proactively monitor activity across the Group’s networks to identify and mitigate possible cyber security threats and data privacy breaches" (Source 13). Partial credit is given since it is not clear from this disclosure whether this monitoring of activity also includes audits, which could help identify risks before they occur.
